content: treble_crochet fptr treble_crochet repeat around slip_stitch to join chain 1 turn 5 20 repeat round 4 remember to turn at the end of each round 21 1tr into each stitch around slip_stitch to join chain 1 turn 22 1dc into each stitch around slip_stitch to join fasten_off edging use 4 50mm hook a smaller hook helps to tighten up the edges to help reduce any wobbles the edging will be worked on both edges of the scarf and consists of just 2 rounds choose an edge top or bottom and instead of working into the tops of the stitches this round will be worked around the posts of the double_crochet round 1 put a slip knot on your hook and insert your hook from the front and around the back of any double_crochet see 1st photo you can see my hook is behind the post of the stitch then just work 1dc around that stitch and then around every stitch all the way around instead of joining the round with a slip_stitch which can sometimes look messy you can create a neat join tips for neat joining are at the end of this document 2 take your dark brown yarn or yarn the same colour you started with and work a round of double_crochet but instead of working into the tops of the stitch insert your hook through the middle of each stitch and through to the back so you will insert your hook here through the v at the top of each stitch do this into each stitch around then either join with a slip_stitch or use the neat join method do the same on the other edge of the scarf 3 pattern hat gauge a 10cm x 10cm square on the hat is approx 19 stitches across and 12 row high use a 5 00mm hook round 1 make a magic_ring then chain 1 work 14tr into the ring pull tight slip_stitch to join ch1 you should have a circle that looks like this round 2 work 1 front post treble_crochet fptr around the 1st treble_crochet then 1 treble_crochet into the space before the 2nd treble_crochet then 1 fptr around the 2nd treble and 1tr into the space … repeat to end slip_stitch to join ch1 at the end of this round you should have 14 fptr & 14 treble_crochet 4 round 3 work 1 fptr around the 1st fptr then 2tr into the space before the next treble_crochet skip over the treble_crochet then work 1 fptr around the next fptr then 2tr into space repeat this all around the repeat pattern is 1 fptr 2tr 1 fptr 2tr slip_stitch to join ch1 at the end of this round you should have - 14 fptr & 28 treble_crochet round 4 this is the trickiest round so plenty of photos are provided as a visual guide and a lighter yarn has been used for the photo to highlight the stitches better the next steps are going to be worked
